Reviews.Title: “Great little place”
Reviews.Author: Neta A
Reviews.Content: OK So this place is really great and in a pretty good location too. Rooms include a hot plate, microwave, tea kettle and some even have a balcony. There's an actual laundry room in the basement where you wash/iron your own clothes. Not bad for an extended stay. If you're traveling with a child or an extra person, request a room with a pull-out couch so you don't have to pay the extra 40 Euros per night for a rollaway bed. Otherwise, the couch is an option but it's pretty uncomfortable. We racked up a bill for 320 Euros for 8 days(adds up fast!) just for the bed...However Adina hotel (up the street) has nice rooms (same type) except smaller -I prefer to say more intimate but equally nice, clean, and a bit more convenient -washer/dryer in your room- either way 60sqm vs 43...you decide! Adina cost 580 Euros for the week, while Mandala was roughly 800 in addition to the expensive rollaway bed! Back to Mandala--There's an exercise room and sauna/quiet room on the top (8th) floor where you can catch a nice sunset while sipping tea. Sauna is VERY clean by the way...I didn't have breakfast there - No need when I can cook my own but it might be something to do on your last day just for the view - I think got the same view drinking tea without the paid breakfast! BTW, there are two grorcery stores very close(Kaisers and Ullrich). 15 minutes walk further is Friedrichstrasse station, there's an Edeka in there but it gets crowded. I didn't drive but I know there's limited underground parking. Internet is great and free. As for negatives---The pillows are lousy! You can fold them in fours and still feel like your head rests on nothing. The rollaway bed which I already mentioned and be careful so they don't try to charge you for anything extra like they did me - pistachios. Mini bar is not free, neither is the chocolate but walk 2 minutes to Fassbender and Rausch for chocolates---You won't regret it!

Reviews.Title: “A perfect located apartment hotel in Mitte Berlin”
Reviews.Author: Molokoo
Reviews.Content: I have stayed there a total of four times during 2009-2010 and have enjoyed every stay. It is really central located in Berlin Mitte and you have the luxury department store Lafayette right next to U. The station (U-bahn) Stadsmitte is literally right next to the hotel, but me personally prefer to walk about the really get to know Berlin. The rooms are huge and every thing is of high standard minus the the teve (really small) and you get good value for you money. There is good restaurant nearby, nut you got a fully equipted kitchen so it´s also suitable for families. There´s a Keyser (food store) in walking distance. I recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A good practical hotel for a business and pleasure visit.”
Reviews.Author: JNKetting
Reviews.Content: If you plan to visit Berlin for business and also want to see something of the city then this is a good hotel. For a purely pleasure visit I would choose a hotel in a bit more lively location. The rooms are good, comfortable and rather big. The gym is good with a nice view for an early morning workout. The breakfast room has the same nice view and decoration but breakfast itself is basic. The bed had a very narrow blanket to sleep under so sleep quality was rather low. The service was good. But an apartment hotel stays an apartment hotel and the look and feel of the place is more of a rented apartment than of a nice hotel. Again, perfect for business but not really ideal for a nice weekend in town.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect in every way.”
Reviews.Author: TrevisoBettiol
Reviews.Content: This hotel is so very comfortable and the apartments are huge. Only thing I've found fault with is the bed is slightly too hard, but I believe this is German style.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, central and very affordable!”
Reviews.Author: 894PaulC
Reviews.Content: We travelled with friends this spring to Berlin, we were exited about visiting this beautiful city and therefore we wanted to get quality accommodation. This hotel worked out for me and my friends very well, we loved the location, The hotel stuff was very friendly and nice, rooms very clean and this hotel is simply GREAT! I would stay here again! Thank you for this great experience!

Reviews.Title: “Spacious, elegant, central, affordable!”
Reviews.Author: lapsaptong
Reviews.Content: When to go... you are on a weekend to explore Berlin and want to stay somewhere central, cozy and a bit elegant. It happened now a few times to me that I opened my hotel room door and I was pleasantly surprised to find a well designed, spacious suite; I like. The suite has a large entrance area, a walk-in wardrobe, bath room with separate toilet, plus a large living room including kitchen and bedroom - wow! Everything is in an elegant style, well equipped; nothing missing. There is not much of a reception, though staff is friendly and they promised that by phone there is somebody available 24/7 (I didn't make use of it). They have a breakfast room / lounge on the 8th floor which continues in its elegant style. I can only recommend this hotel. When to avoid...

Reviews.Title: “wow”
Reviews.Author: Sabitasera
Reviews.Content: this is a five star hotel. The suite was out of this world. Would have preferred to have enough wine glasses in the room (given only one) so don't have to call housekeeping every day, but maybe this is part of the plan? Don't know. the service is excellent and this hotel bar makes the very best martini in Germany!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: fanharuka
Reviews.Content: All fantastic. Right in Potsdam Square, very nice atmosphere, very good service, wide room and furniture high level. Breakfast in a amazing room with many different kind of sweets, fruits, yougurts and salted food. We have been there for a business meeting and we had very good time. I'd suggest to try also Spa and massage service: everything at the highest level.

Reviews.Title: “Best place to stay in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: Eaton835
Reviews.Content: This is my third stay at the Mandala Suites - I had stayed at the Mandala Hotel on Potsdamer Strasse in previous visits. I and my wife cannot say enough positive things about the Mandala Suites. The location is of course fabulous, as suggested by the U-Bahn station 100 meters away - "Stadmitte" (City Center); the rooms are spacious; the decor is lovely and comfortable; the layout - closets, shelves, etc. make it extremely convenient living. The staff is always super-pleasant, courteous, helpful, and immediately responsive to every request. I give the Mandala Suites my highest recommendation.

Reviews.Title: “We decided to stay longer”
Reviews.Author: Chillimudcrab
Reviews.Content: We too have a managers suite not on a high floor but fantastic nonetheless, service is perfect, ultra clean great under cover parking, close to everything, U Bahn right out the front to everywhere, not looking forward to leaving really

Reviews.Title: “Very spacious rooms and great value at the heart in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: Quantumlondon1
Reviews.Content: We had the management suite which has a spacious bedroom and a separate lounge with small kitchen. Separate bathroom and toilet. Free in-room wifi with good signal. Reception is helpful but not as knowledgeable as a hotel concierge.

Reviews.Title: “very good, high standard”
Reviews.Author: Kimmie007
Reviews.Content: Stay here for three nights. It was the third time we were here and it was very comfotable. Good price and really enjoyed it. dreamlike breakfast in 8. floor lounge, with a majestic view over Berlin. Best central location lafayette , französische strasse, unter den linden only a few minutes to go. also the lower friedrichstrasse with its sceneful boutics and shops. love it and come again when we stay in berlin

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotels -- an oasis in a beautiful area!”
Reviews.Author: freshairfan
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a management suite on the fifth floor for 6 nights, and could not find a single thing to complain about. We had a separate bedroom, with a sliding (pocket) door to the living room (shut at night but open during the day), a kitchen and a luxurious bathroom with an enormous tub. Excellent toiletries. The draperies worked beautifully to darken the room at night, and the floor-to-ceiling windows opened both at the top and side to give great ventilation. For everything we received, the price was reasonable (150 Euros/night). The bed (kingsize) was perfect -- not overly firm and not too soft and the bedding was high quality. Windows overlooked a street combining older buildings with carved facades and modern architecture. The room was quiet; we heard no noise from neighbors or from the street. Breakfast was outstanding -- a fantastic selection of meats, cheeses, pastries, great yogurts with muesli, eggs, even outstanding coffee and cappuccino -- and in a beautiful room with a view of the rooftops in the area. We commented on the pastries since they were so extraordinarily good, unlike the typical fare, and found out that they get them fresh every morning from one of the best bakeries in town. That commitment to quality showed in every aspect. Newspapers in several languages, including the International Herald Tribune, were available in the breakfast room. The location in the Mitte can't be beat: a 2-minute walk to the Gendarmenmarkt with two beautiful churches and the concert hall and outdoor cafes (and almost constant live music by groups outside these cafes), and 1/2 block to the underground. The hotel is located in a business/retail section, which is a bit surprising, but so close to the cafes and restaurants of the Gendarmenmarkt area (which clearly attracts both locals and tourists) that it feels very homey. You can walk almost everywhere if you have good shoes, even to the beautiful and artsy Prenzlauerberg (about 3 miles, or an hour on foot). The Mandala Suites a concierge, but the staff on the first floor are extremely helpful. (We bought full-day metro passes from them directly, which was very useful.) We didn't check to see if room service was available, but with cafes and restaurants everywhere, and the amazing breakfasts, you won't want it. They have a small fitness area with a sauna which looks quite nice (we peeked in) but we didn't use it. Wifi (very good signal) was available at a reasonable price if you purchase a whole week, and somewhat less reasonable at a daily rate. This would be the one thing I would encourage the management to reconsider. I've stayed in dozens of great hotels in Europe, India, Japan, So. America, the U.S. and this is one of my favorites. Berlin is an amazing cosmopolitan city, and this is the best place to stay in our opinion. We loved this hotel and plan to return. One tip -- we highly recommend visiting the Stasi Prison (Hohenschönhausen Memorial Center) on the outskirts of Berlin. This was one of the most interesting and moving parts of our trip. http://berlin.barwick.de/sights/east-berlin/hohenschoenhausen-memorial-center-prison-museum.html.

Reviews.Title: “large room for a decent price in berlin mitte”
Reviews.Author: JollapParis
Reviews.Content: Perfect location next to Gendarmenplatz for a very large room/suite with kitchen facility. Quiet area. Be aware that no front office clerks are available after 9pm. Good quality/price option.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to start and finish your day in Berlin"”
Reviews.Author: Travelvegzz
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Management Suite - a large, spacious and very elegant apartment with good size bedroom and walk in wardrobe to store you luggage away. Separate WC is a nice bonus for those girls, who love long bubble baths to unwind after a busy walking day about the city. Fitness is small but rather well thought through, as well as the wellness zone, one thing lacking though is a bench to drop you things and get dressed after - had to stand balancing on one foot. Breakfast is great and with a fab view over the city. A great start for a day. A friendly and hardly noticeable staff were fantastic. If you arrive late your key card is stored with the security who will guide you up to your room. We also ordered opera tickets to be delivered to the hotel – they were waiting for us together with the key card on the night of arrival. Very thoughtful. The location is great for walking around Berlin Mitte and riding just about everywhere else. The hotel offers free bicycle rent. Highly recommend to anyone who does not want to pay top dollar and yet get all the best from one of the most dynamic cities in Europe.

Reviews.Title: “Huge room, central located, however..”
Reviews.Author: tyst
Reviews.Content: Pros: Spacious room, well located,no tourists in groups at all, clean, neat,and quiet, serious buffet breakfast and staffs who are in charge of it. Cons: no free wifi . one of the receptionist was not very friendly when I asked her infos about Air France office in Berlin, I mean she probably tried very hard not showing any upset, or impatience, but I believed any customer can tell what her hood was. For example, she intentionally hang on the telephone or put a water glass heavily on the desk, which showed she was upset about something, and kind of impatient about my question..I don't think a hotel so serious like Mandala should allow this kind of rudeness to happen.

Reviews.Title: “All you need”
Reviews.Author: Maria64
Reviews.Content: Location; Two stops from train station Friedrichstr. Stadtmitte metro/U bahn (U2 en U6) on your door step. If you want to explore the city, this is a nice middle to get to all the area's. Also nice to have a shopping street on your doorstep (e.g. to get wine at Galleries Lafayette). But even a good walk to main attractions. Loved the Gendarmen Platz around the corner with nice cafe's around to have your last drink before go back to room. Is not a low budget area. Suite; Nice to have a walk-in closet, so lots of space to hang your clothes. Kitchen if needed, with good size balcony. Nice and quiet in the room. Room (apartment) is spacious. Do not expect nice lobby area or communal spaces. All clean fairly new and well maintained. Business orientated. Service ; Breakfast was an experience. Beautiful white area, good view over the city (8th floor) with nicely decorated tables. Well arranged buffet with all we needed. Juice, tea, coffee, eggs are served by personnel. Very service minded. Also reception is very helpful and friendly but are only available at set times. We did not mind.

Reviews.Title: “excellent”
Reviews.Author: MrFr
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a 3 night break. Ideal location and very comfortable. Room was basically an apartment with bedroom, living room, kitchenette, bathoom, toilet and walk in store. Very clean and well equipped. Staff were very helpful. Breakfast was good. Choice of various cereals, breads etc. Ideal location. short walk to under der linden, postdammer platz, alexander platz. checkpoint charlie just down the street. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal Hotel for a Berlin Getaway.”
Reviews.Author: evelineip
Reviews.Content: My husband was in Berlin for business and we extended our stay over the weekend to enjoy the city. This hotel is situated in the best location in Berlin, by Gendarmenmarkt in the Mitte district. Most attractions are either a walk or short metro or cab ride away. The Mandala Suites itself is like a home away from home. Their suites are very spacious and tastefully furnished. The kitchenette comes in handy on an extended stay. We stayed in room 510 and on a previous trip in 210. The breakfast buffet is located on the top floor of the building, which provides magnificent views on the skyline and rooftops in Berlin. Even on a gloomy day, it looks pretty striking. The buffet itself is well stocked with a good variety of nutritious food. Make sure breakfast is included in your bill though as it does come at a EUR18 per head premium. But worry not, the Kamps bakery and Einstein cafe on the complex's ground floors provide the best bread and coffee in town. By next check out the Newton bar, a short walk away from the Mandala Suites. This is probably the best cocktail bar in Berlin. To conclude, the Madala Suites score maximum marks for location, cleanliness, rooms, value, and sleep quality. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms but beware of the food”
Reviews.Author: TheDon070
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel very spacious food but my suffered from food poisoning after eating prawns from the buffet breakfast. I wrote to the hotel over a month ago and have yet to receive a reply

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel suits, - amazing location...”
Reviews.Author: BirgitteDK
Reviews.Content: Firstly: location location location ... You can not find a more central place to stay if you want to live in the middle of Berlin, right on Friedrichstraße, with shops right outside your door. . Only a 5 minutes walk from Checkpoint Charlie, a 5 minutes walk from the "Gendarmenmarkt". A 15 minutes walk from the "Reichstag", "Denkmal für die Juden ermordeten Europe", "Berliner Dom", and "Under dem Linden) Lots of different restaurants, both for morning, afternoon and evening. We - two adults and a two-year boy, lived in a "Management Suite" for five days. Great apartment with huge hallway, separate toielet and bathroom with shower and bathtub and an extra room for storage. Large living room and a large bedroom (great beds) separated by a wall and a solid sliding door. Kitchen with everything you could want (free coffee hot chocolate and tea). We have never stayed at such a clean hotel and there were not so much noise as we expected, when you consider location of the hotel. We did not have breakfast at the hotel (23 euros. per person per day) but there is a delicious bakey right beside the hotel, open from early morning. There is a great - brand new - gym on the eighth floor overlooking the city. There is a large parking garage underneath the hotel, with elevator right up to the apartments. (18 euros pr. day) The Mandala is highly recommended, both for families with children, elderly, singles and couples ...

Reviews.Title: “A real find - especially on an extended trip”
Reviews.Author: Hampronstraveller
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights in the middle of a 20 day trip. A great break from the usual hotel. Large suites, great breakfast, good prices, top location and above all a free laundry room. Also terrific AC during the 95 degree (unusual heat). Warning - this is a hotel frequented by business travelers often on extended stays and not staffed by a concierge who can give a lot of help - although the services of the staff at the Mandala Hotel are available. Ideal for the independent experienced traveller.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, conveniently located, spacious, quiet and well-appointed hotel suite(s) in the heart of Berlin, Germany.”
Reviews.Author: garyrichards1019
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a comfortable, conveniently located, spacious, quiet and well-appointed hotel suite in the very heart of Berlin, Germany, then this is the place for you. I was needing this kind of room for six nights (July 4 - 9, 2010) while visiting Berlin and Germany for the very first time just prior to a visit I was making to Finland to visit special friends of mine there. The Mandala Suites was perfect for me and was the ideal location that I needed and was looking for. Located approx. three blocks south of Unter den Linden, the main east-west thoroughfare through central Berlin (formerly East Berlin, the Mandala Suites is located on energetic and cosmopotlitan Friedrichstrasse, which is overflowing with contemporary restaurants, shops, etc. It is also conveniently located to the U-bahn or subway system. Taxis make frequent and regular stops in the vicinity as well, which I needed and took advantage of on a number of occasions, though I walked Berlin most of the time and/or participated in guided "themed" walking tours of Berlin on 4 of the 6 days during my visit. The only two things I would say were a negative or a slight negative were the following: 1) Though the buffet breakfast that the hotel offers on the 7th or 8th floor was excellent and very convenient (I ate breakfast there each morning during my stay), it was 18 Euros per breakfast, which I thought was a bit expensive and over the top. I did not realize that breakfast was 18 Euros / breakfast until the moment I was checking out of the hotel. I have only myself to blame for this, because I should have asked them in advance how much breakfast cost.....I normally ask these kinds of questions in advance, but due to travel overload and too much to think about and to do after arriving in Berlin, I simply never got around to asking this most important question. I certainly will not repeat this mistake in the future, no matter where I travel or stay. However, the service was excellent, the view of the city from the restaurant was wonderful, I enjoyed reading the complimentary English language newspaper that was available to me and to others, so all in all, I took advantage of all that was offered me and was glad that I did once I found out the cost of the breakfast. 2) Even though the bathroom in my suite was large, very clean, brighly lit and well appointed, I have to say that the tub itself was very dangerous and was / is a problem just waiting to happen to someone. It was very slippery inside the tub and when I went to get in and out of the tub each morning, I had to do so with extreme care and caution for fear of slipping and falling down. There definitely should be some kind of safey mat on the floor of the tub to prevent people from potentially falling and seriously hurting themselves. I am certain that I am not the first person who has ever noticed and/or mentioned this. The flooring in the bathroom is all smooth polished tile that becomes very slippery once it becomes wet. I had to always place a towel just outside my tub to make sure I landed on a secure surface when getting out of the tub each morning. The Mandala Suites management most definitely needs to reexamine its current design plans for its bathrooms, as they are a serious problem just waiting to happen to someone.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay in a snowy Berlin”
Reviews.Author: dk1174
Reviews.Content: I spent 5 days at a suite at Mandala suites during February 2010. 5 very very relaxing days in such a cozy and charming environment. The hotel staff was very helpful giving us any info we aimed for, and by far very discrete. Suites were clean and spacey. Hotels position was identical. Just a step from Metro station and directly in the heart of New Berlins developing Market. When planning for my next Excursion to Berlin, I do not have to search for other hotel to stay. Mandala is there 4 me!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, though it was housed in what seemed to be a bank. Strange.”
Reviews.Author: mattkorey
Reviews.Content: You could not beat the Mandala Suite's location on Friedrichstrasse, in the thick of it all. It is a little hard to find the hotel itself though as it is in the middle of some office complex or bank or something, very un-hotel-ish. That part is totally fine though since you can come and go as you please with the key and it's sort of like your own city space. I loved the decor of the public spaces (restaurant, hallways, gym), but the rooms themselves, while very large suites, are very boring in their decor, sort of stilted and classic I guess you would say. This is very different from the Mandala Hotel, though the Suites are a good bit less expensive. The breakfast room has a great view onto the city and the staff are quite helpful and nice. A limited number of bikes are available to guests free of charge, which is a great touch, just reserve early or they will be gone. The only negative I found, other than the room decor, was the hefty wifi fee. A hotel of this caliber (the Mandala group) should surely offer this free of charge as most hotels do these days. There is one laptop that they will let you use, but there is usually someone using it and one would likely prefer to be free to use one's own laptop in your room. All in all, thumbs up.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: AverageTraveller1
Reviews.Content: The hotel has very spacious rooms (suites) for a very reasonable charge. The staff are very friendly in the breakfast room on the top floor, from where there's a good view of the city. (They even gave me a gift on the morning of the day I checked out!) The breakfast includes good espresso, which is never easy to find in a hotel. The location makes it very convenient, with the Unter Den Linden, Brandenburger Tor, Reichstag, Checkpoint Charlie and Topographie des Terrors at easy walking distances, and the shopping/dining area of Friedrichstrasse right at hand. The Mitte district and Museum Island are a little farther away, but still walkable. The U-Bahn station is a half-block from the hotel, so it's easy to get to other spots in the city (such as the Ku'damm) too.

Reviews.Title: “I will be back here.”
Reviews.Author: ClaffCork
Reviews.Content: Great to have lots of space. These apart-hotels are really spacious, modern and really central to all the sights. People are super friendly and breakfast is lovely. Ich werde wiederkommen!

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel ever...”
Reviews.Author: dtriphook
Reviews.Content: INCREDIBLE INCREIBLE Nothing bad to say about it but a lot of good things to tell, but better going there and enjoy...Nice rooms, nice food...(well, some strange juices)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel. Highly recommended.”
Reviews.Author: Advisor31
Reviews.Content: Good size. Good design. Magnificent Breakfast Room. Staff very professional. Very relaxing to stay here, either business or pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotels I've ever stayed”
Reviews.Author: IP79Barcelona
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my husband in The Mandal Suites between 17th December until 21st December in a Management Suite. We hadn't any outstanding problem during all stay. The location of the Mandala is perfect, very closed to the best atractions and in front of the underground. This is really useful in special when the weather is so cold. We have deeply appreciated the possibility of going in and out of the hotel without passing for reception because that allow you to have the illusion of living the city. The rooms are well soundproof, no noise annoyed us. They are wide, well conditioned and with all that it's necessary to pass a good stay, in special the little kitchen. The staff helped us with everything we need. We had only a small problem. The third day, the fridge was spoilt and despite we remarked it in reception, it wasn't repaired. Another negative point is that the breakfast, although it was abundant, seemed us too expensive (18€). I also think that a hotel of this category should have free wifi in the rooms for their customers, and not only one Internet free point in the lounge that it's opened only during the breakfast. In spite of this, we will choose again the Mandala Suites in our next visit to Berlin and we will recommend it to my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel I've ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: McDange
Reviews.Content: The Mandala Suites is easily the best hotel I've spent time in. Visited there in March 2009 for business and as I was point of contact for the booking I was given an upgrade. From first arrival the hotel staff were excellent and very attentive and the room itself was perfect - massive with several rooms. Unfortunately due to being on business I didn't get much time to spend in the room but would recommend it to anyone visiting the city who has money to spend on good accommodation. U Bhan stop directly across the street which gives access to the entire city.

Reviews.Title: “Mandala's service and appointments were impeccable. Friendly staff, great location.”
Reviews.Author: MHallGator
Reviews.Content: Traveled to Berlin on a short vacation. Mandala is in the epicenter of shopping and sites. Brandenburg Gate and Checkpoint Charlie are a short walk, Museum Island is about a ten minute walk. Great bakery in the bottom of the hotel (independently owned). The Mandala staff was accomodating, we had a wonderful stay.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay in this hotel again!”
Reviews.Author: whitelotusflower
Reviews.Content: Great location. Well appointed suites, equipped with everything you'll need for a short or longer term stay. Children friendly, and near 2 wonderful shopping centers and a good sushi restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Huge rooms, good value”
Reviews.Author: thrall
Reviews.Content: N.B. There are two Mandalas (a Hotel and Suites) which may be confused from the Mandala web site. This is the Suites and not the design Hotel (which also consists of suites) in the nearby Potsdamer Platz. On to the review... The location is superb. A block from the beautiful Gendarmenmarkt, near to many restaurants, and on the Friedrichstrasse shopping street, the Suites are located about 1/2 mile from the Museums Insel and the bulk of the sights in the historical quarters. The U-bahn runs just underneath providing fast, easy access to the farther reaches of the city. The style and feel of the Mitte in the eastern half is quite different from that of the western half. We loved it. We booked a Management Suite (their smallest) for a very fair price. It had a whopping 68 square meters; a combined living/sleeping room; a separate, equipped kitchen; a large, sparkling bathroom with big towels; and a balcony. No rooms with twin beds are available, so it may not be suitable for travel with a business associate. The decor was bland with bamboo furniture, but they hung nice old photos, and everything was kept clean. The arrangement is like an apartment complex. The front desk is in a separate area of the building, so one has ample privacy when coming and going. N.B. The staff is only on duty until the evening hours on weekdays and late afternoon on weekends, so take this into consideration if you must check in late or if you require advice, assistance, etc. The helpful staff will arrange most amenities for their guests: personal shoppers, baby sitting, rental cars, massage, flowers, etc. Free washing machines, loaner bikes, and laptop/DVD's are also available. DSL and wireless internet are 10 euros per day. The rooms have air-conditioning and safes (not laptop-sized). On the top floor, the breakfast room is drenched with light. If you don't get breakfast included in your rate, it is 18 euros. Eggs can be cooked to order, and there are over 100 tiny dishes of things to sample. But the content is still the German-style breakfast with meats, cheeses, and breads. In the future, I will request a room on a higher floor. There was almost no cell phone coverage from two different companies; and being on the first floor, I could hear the subway trains rumble through underneath every 4 minutes, vibrating the room like a didgeridoo. But we will still be back.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place to stay”
Reviews.Author: SusieD50
Reviews.Content: Wonderful location and wonderful accommodation. We had a management suite that was very spacious, well equipped and extremely comfortable. It was a lovely, quiet haven to relax in after a days sightseeing. I would recommend the Mandala Suites to anyone and wouldn't hesitate to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: kkm_8
Reviews.Content: I am a single female, who travels worldwide weekly for business and several times a year for vacations. I write very few reviews. The Mandala Suites deserves a great review. I was fortunate enough to stay in 2 different rooms the same trip (my flights were cancelled due to a hurricane at home and they helped to accomodate my extra day). Below are my quick impressions. 1. Very Clean (I'm in Medical & can be very germ phobic; this is very important to me) 2. 1st room on 7th floor was 800sq ft. open and very comfortable. 3. Cleaning staff was quick, courteous and reliable 4. Front desk staff was VERY accomodating/helpful and always cheerful 5. Rooms were quiet and well supplied 6. Showers for a Europe hotel (not always what an American expects) were clean, large, and had plenty of really hot water 7. Great location for shopping, the convention center, restaurants and tours. In total, "A Great place to stay" and I hope there staff receives many compliments!

Reviews.Title: “Very good value for money”
Reviews.Author: MMHA
Reviews.Content: Stayed there in september 2008. Rooms are big and at a high standard. The furniture and interior is quite good, considering it is a hotel. Best of all is the location - absolutely the best place to stay in Berlin when it comes to restaurants, shopping and sightseeing. Finally I would say that it is a plus, that the hotel is very quiet. MMH/Denmark

Reviews.Title: “Excelent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: june666
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on May 29th and made reservation on Hotels' website. Getting there: Hotel is located right at the Stadtmitte U-Bahn station. Room was capacious , clean, quite. Staff were very friendly and very helpfull. One of the best hotels I ever stayed in Europe. I recomment it to families and couples.

Reviews.Title: “Great suite, great price, great stay”
Reviews.Author: Great_Dane_Dillema
Reviews.Content: Our stay was excellent. The staff were very polite, friendly, helpful and welcoming. The suite itself was extremely comfortable, as well as being very secure. The kitchen area was perfect, and had plenty of utensils and tableware. The room was very clean and kept clean throughout our stay. The only area that we were disappointed with was that the linen was not changed during our 5 night stay. I would have expected one change of towels during our stay and that the shower gel and shampoo bottles would have been restocked once used. Other than that, the suite made our stay in Berlin a very enjoyable experience. It was wonderful to have such a large and welcoming space to retire to, after a long day of sightseeing and shopping! I will definitely be recommending the Mandala Suites to anybody who intends to travel to Berlin. For the money, I just can't see how this place could be beat. If you're after the complete hotel experience however i.e. room service etc, stay elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic value for money”
Reviews.Author: Wicks73
Reviews.Content: For value for money this hotel rates very highly. Huge room that was tastefully decorated and showed no sign of wear and tear. Rooms also come equipped with kitchenette which I guess would be useful if you were here for a longer stay. Great location, located on one of the main shopping streets in the city and only a few minutes walk to the Brandenburg Gate, Checkpoint Charlie and museums. I have stayed at the 5* Adlon hotel before which is a lovely hotel, but if you're looking for a cheaper alternative for a weekend away this is a great hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Auscaz
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Mandala Suites for three nights last week and it was fantastic. It is situated in Friederichstrasse (?spelling), within a short stroll of the Brandenburg Gate, Checkpoint Charlie etc. I chose it because of its close proximity to the fabulous Gendaremenmarkt Christmas market. The apartment was spacious and fully selfcontained. There is no washing machine/dryer in the apartment itself however apparently there is a laundry for guests in the basement of the building. Breakfast is served on the 8th floor every morning. From memory I think we paid around ten euro for 24 hours on the internet, which was far better than the 22 euro we paid for 24 hours in our hotel in Leipzig! At 130 euro per night, it was outstanding value for money and we would definitely stay there again next time. There is an awesome bakery about 20 metres up the road that opens at 7am and sells great coffee and an amazing array of breads/cakes etc.

Reviews.Title: “Good and central location with minor flaws”
Reviews.Author: tami01
Reviews.Content: The Mandala Suites are centrally located at Friedrichstrasse Berlin, the destination of all luxury addicted travellers who are visiting the German capital. The hotel is part of a larger atrium office building and not well known with Berlin taxi drivers - so better be prepared to know the address. Very Small lobby & friendly service. The rooms are starting at 40 sqm up to more than 80 sqm - all with kitchen. No extremly stylish furniture - discreet elegance might a proper description. Comfortable beds, ok--ish bathrooms. No extravaganza. Wireless and LAN costs 10 € a day. The six day access is for 30 € - easly calculation what is the better choice. Connectivity inbound is ok, outbond can be a catastrophy, if you are not only checking your emails on the internet but work with an application such as Outlook, Lotus Notes etc. Room orientation varies pretty much - some are towards the glass attrium, which is a really calm place, others have windows and balconies to Friedrichstrasse (noisy) or attached streets (rel. noisy as well). Breakfast room on the 8th floor has very modern interieur, but - far too less tables. It can easly happen to you that you have to sit on the couch and wait for several minutes to get a table - unpleaseant, when you have time pressure. Buffet is good to very good, extras such as eggs or orange juice will be served at order. Long serving hours for people who like to sleep longer. View towards Potsdamer Platz, Reichstag, Siegessaeule etc. is impressive. Fitness room and sauna available at the same floor. In a nutshell: +Centrally located for business, getting around and upper class shopping +Good breakfast and beds +Possible tricky internet connectivity Solid, but nothing to fall in love with. Will try the Mandala Hotel at Potsdamer Platz or the SAS Radisson next time.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious rooms, excellent internet connection”
Reviews.Author: JanneSiru
Reviews.Content: Great location, extremely spacious room (55m2) and excellent internet connection (ADSL, 20M+). For business traveller good internet connection is more than vital if you want to keep up with your daily emails. Working space, living room area and full kitchen made our stay pleasant. Underground station (lines U2 and U6) is just few steps away. Good basic german restaurant Maximilian is also located in the same building and Starbucks cross the street. Other restaurant option is a Sushi bar but other dinner options were pretty limited. Good feature is chance to move tv-set easily from living room area to bedroom if you want to. There is also enough space for your clothes and other staff since the room is designed for longer stays. We stayed only four nights.

Reviews.Title: “Very well appointed, huge rooms. Fantastic.”
Reviews.Author: ToddParis
Reviews.Content: I can't really add much more than has already been said, other than to add another voice to the positive reviews. I find it extraordinary that this hotel isn't ranked in the top 2 pages for Berlin. Maybe it's because it's more of an apartment concept, maybe not that many non-Germans stay here. It easily rates in my top 5 European hotel experiences, and I stay in 50+ hotels a year. This is a sensational hotel. Rooms are very cleverly designed, incredibly spacious, and comfortable. Room layout, and bathrooms, are very very grand. Everything worked well. Such a refreshing experience. Bar is also very good. I totally recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “A very disappointing experience”
Reviews.Author: Garygr
Reviews.Content: When we booked our reservation in February 2007 we were told that the hotel would be air conditioned. Upon our arrival we were informed that our room did not have air conditioning and that there were no rooms with air conditioning available for our entire 5 day stay. Although the room was large and well appointed, the lack of air conditioning meant needing to leave the windows and curtains open at night. Being on the 2nd floor meant that all the street lights were shining through our windows. The traffic noise began at 5:30 a.m. The staff was unresponsive and indifferent to our complaints and we moved to a hotel with air conditioning.

Reviews.Title: “Great place!”
Reviews.Author: Travel0h0lic
Reviews.Content: We booked the Mandala Suites for a week-end getaway in March 2007 and liked it a lot. The location is very central close to the Galeries Lafayette shopping mall and other stores. The subway stop 'Stadtmitte' is just outside the door. For €210/night for 3 pers, we had a 68 m2 suite including: - 1 spacious bedroom with lots of closets and a safe; - 1 living room, which also had a desk with internet connection (An extra bed for our teenager had been put in the living room. It was nice that they had left the couch untouched and added an extra bed - so we could still sit and enjoy the sitting area), both rooms had a TV and a CD player in the living room; - 1 fully equipped kitchen open into the living room (incl microwave, fridge, dishwasher and everything you need to eat/cook) ; - 1 bathroom with separate toilet; plus - a huge empty hall (a bit of a waste of space in our view - would have been better planned if used for a bigger bathroom... or some sitting furniture) with a walk-in closet. The suite also has a small balcony overlooking a courtyard, not very pretty but the court is certainly extremely quiet and much calmer than the busy Friedrichsstrasse on the other side. I believe most ,if not all, rooms overlook the courtyard. Breakfast was nice served in a very modern lounge on the top floor with nice views. One comment though - the lounge is rather small so when the hotel is full I can image it can be tricky to get a table at peak hours. However, this didn't happen to us. There is no restaurant in the hotel but plenty in the surroundings. The staff is young, smiling and very helpful. They made us feel welcome, and advised us of good places to eat and reserved tables/taxis when we asked. We only stayed 2 nights. The Mandala Suites is really an apartment hotel and excellent for the traveller who stays longer in Berlin. I read something about them providing cheaper nightly rates for longer stays and they use the slogan 'Home Away'. Very true. Good value, great place that I fully recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location”
Reviews.Author: AlbanB
Reviews.Content: Great central in the very centre of Berlin. Large and tastefully decorated suite. Great Breakfast. Decent rate. I'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Excellent appartment-hotel with huge rooms and nice breakfast. Great location! It´s callend now: The Madala Suites.

Reviews.Title: “Home from home in the heart of Berlin”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is not your ordinary hotel. What this facility offers is a large number of suites. I paid €109 a night for a suite that was bigger than my own flat. It was brand new, with two bedrooms, a sitting room, a wonderful bathroom and a fully equiped kitchen. I also had a nice balcony over a courtyard. If you like bellboys, and room service, and concierges then shoot for another hotel. However, if you are in Berlin for more than a couple of days, I would seriously consider staying here. It couldn't be better located, being as it is situated on the Friedrichstrasse, opposite Gendarmenmarkt. You have some of the best restaurants in town on your doorstep but if they don't tickle your fancy, you have your own kitchen. If ever I go to Berlin (at least five times a year) this is where I stay. But hush, don't tell everybody.
